definition: to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]
table/desk/classifier for tables of guests at a banquet etc
to sit at a table with others with whom one is unacquainted
rickshaw seat (Beijing dialect)/patron (of teahouse, cinema)/passenger (in taxi, rickshaw etc)
to chatter idly/to gossip/to boast or brag
old-fashioned square table to seat eight people
(of a performer) to put on a show at an outdoor venue (temple fair, marketplace etc)/(fig.) to enhance sb's reputation/to make a name for oneself
table/desk/classifier for tables of guests at a banquet etc
teahouse/tea-stall with seats/tea-garden or teahouse seat
erhua variant of 飯館|饭馆[fan4 guan3]
